symptoms.name: Pain
symptoms.pattern: Associated with lesions, particularly in interdigital locations

symptoms.name: Skin rash
symptoms.pattern: May or may not be present; often on hands and feet in untreated cases

symptoms.name: Swelling in lymph nodes
symptoms.pattern: May be present near affected area

physical_findings: Large verrucous/nodular lesion (3 cm in diameter)
Multiple nodular lesions in inguinal regions and on penis
Raised lesions with pink fleshy edges surrounding a friable erythematous center

lab_values.TRUST: Positive (1:64 in one case; 1:4 after treatment in another)

required: Positive serology for syphilis (e.g., RPR, TRUST)
Histopathological findings consistent with condyloma latum (e.g., prominent irregular epidermal hyperplasia, mixed inflammatory infiltrate, positive Treponema pallidum immunostain)
supportive: Clinical presentation of nodular or verrucous lesions, often in anogenital area or areas of skin apposition
Presence of white spots on lesion surface (dermoscopically visible)
